featured.text: The economic crisis may have also played a role: Homeowners who were not able to pay their bank loans were forced to abandon their properties, sometimes leaving behind swimming pools that made excellent mosquito breeding grounds.
It looked the way Amy felt--lonely and abandoned.
Luckily they both escaped unharmed, but their boat was badly damaged and they had to abandon their journey.
However, since it kept orbiting around the Earth without any consequences, scientists became increasingly comfortable abandoning things that no longer served any useful purpose in space.
So, alas, Franklin’s marvelous invention was ultimately abandoned.

definition.en_def: To leave something behind or to give up on something.
definition.example: She decided to abandon her old car and buy a new one.
